Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Michael grunts and strains while doing push-ups] Breathe. Work your core. Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, what did you do today?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, sitting on your big fat butt. Alright, that is the number to beat.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What do we get if we do 'em?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My respect. [everyone returns to work] Okay, I'll make it a little more interesting. Anyone who does more than 25 push-ups -

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Gets to go home. [everyone starts to do push-ups] Ooh! I say 'dance,' they say 'how high?' Here we go. Oh, no. No, no, no. Butt to high. [steps on Angela] Disqualified!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What do we got? Creed, disqualified.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: 19. [grunts] I had a really hard work out this morning.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Stanley straining and breathing heavily] Oh, wow, that is adorable!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Essentially, what we have here is one of those stories where a mother lifts a car to save her baby.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, it's not exactly fair. He's got all of his weight that's helping him go down.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: 25. Yeah! Come on, you can do it!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: One more, one more! [cheers and applause]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well... Hey, uh, are you doing anything later tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Matt
Quote.Text: I don't know. I'm free. If you hear of anything going on, let me know.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah, we talked this morning and we talked at Christmas. So, a little momentum there. [tries to open door, locked] Just a couple of hours to kill before work.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You know what we haven't done in a while? Happy hour. Upstairs, the warehouse, everybody just going out for a drink.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Didn't we? I think we did.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You want me to invite Matt?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah, the whole gang, Matt included.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Look, just be straight with me, man. You can be gay with Matt, just be straight with me.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hmmm, I saw a new drink on TV I'd like to try. I'll ask Bob.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, I love going to bars with Bob. I tend to wear something low-cut, get men to flirt with me, and Bob beats 'em up. What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: A bunch of us are talking about happy hour.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I would love, love, love to go. Only problem is, Pam's at home with the baby and I think she wants a night in.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Absolutely, I will do that right now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I gotta tell you, this baby is amazing. She gets me out of everything. And I - and I love her. I also love her, very much.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So some of the co-workers were thinking of going out tonight, but I told them-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on phone] Yes! Yes! I would love to!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [through phone] It's been so long since I've been with adults. I am so excited to see everybody. Creed, Ryan. Oh my God, Stanley! Stanley's going to be there. Yes, oh my God!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I did not see this coming.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Erin, I need you to fax this and get me a confirmation, pronto. [whispering] Are you going later?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Talk to me that way again, and I'll cut your face off.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We recently struck up a romantic relationship. And, um... but we're kinda keeping it quiet for now 'cause it's still kind of a new thing. It's a little delicate, and we just don't want all the drama.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, cause when everyone knows- [knock on window, open blinds to Kevin giggling and making sexual gestures] That's actually pretty funny, but in general, you know.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: A bunch of us are going to get some drinks, you in?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ladies and gentleman, it is quitting time.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Trying to get a head count.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All right, yes! It's a deal.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, I invited my friend Julie.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I want her to meet Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: They're both single, I have a sense they might-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You've been gone for a long time.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It is not that. Kevin! Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, I missed you so much.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Waaah! [starts to make crying baby noises]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: When a new mom hears a baby cry, her you-know-what's fill up with you-know-what, and then her shirt gets, you know... that would be funny.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, wow, I cannot believe this is happening. This is everything I dreamed. Oh, my God! [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's not a birthday, it's not a good-bye party...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, Pam and I are gonna go play pool with one of her friends, and we need a fourth.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Would you like to be our fourth?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: So, the guy shows me the deck he's built. And I'm like, 'I'll call this a deck if it'll make you happy, but this is just a porch without a roof.' [laughter, Oscar looks toward door] It was ridiculous man, it was like-you could maybe get two chairs on the thing. Two lawn chairs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is a nice girl like you hanging out with these bums for? [Julie laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Julie
Quote.Text: So you work with Pam and Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no. Pam and Jim work for me. And if they win, they are fired.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No, not really. Not really, but they better not win.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Isabel, you made it. Oh, my goodness.

Quote.Speaker: Isabel
Quote.Text: Um, I'm gonna do a lap. See if I know anyone.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: And then they said the most ridiculous thing about Anderson Cooper, which I do not have the decency to repeat, but trust me when I tell you that-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hold that thought. Well, well, well. If it isn't Isabel.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's a girl like you doing in a place like this?

Quote.Speaker: Isabel
Quote.Text: A girl like me is why a guy like you comes to a place like this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Usually means there's a battle scene coming.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: See, I didn't think you could teach that. I thought that was something you were born with. What am I thinking right now?

Quote.Speaker: Julie
Quote.Text: Are you thinking that I said 'ESP?'

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. I feel like an idiot. Awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Julie
Quote.Text: I was a little nervous when Pam told me he was her boss, but he doesn't act like a boss at all. If I had a boss like that, we'd never get anything done.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: About you two hitting it off.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [removing tie] Well, apparently, Michael Scott is on a date. And that, that my friend, changes everything. [puts on backwards golf cap]

Quote.Speaker: Hide
Quote.Text: My brother, good head, bad heart. Good head, bad heart.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Michael, where have you been? [Michael shoots pool ball up into their faces]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, you're supposed to hit the white ball first, buddy. Nice one. Can I talk to you for a sec? All right. Everything ok?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why are you wearing a hat now?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Guys, come on, I'm on a date. Let me do my thang.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi, I'm date Mike. Nice to meet me. How do you like your eggs in the morning? [tries to wink]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You want to just make a run for it?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Waaaah! [Kevin fake-cries into Pam's chest] Waaaaah! Mommy!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: We're focusing, we're focusing, we can't talk.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Guys, guys, guys, please. [game ends] Ok, all right, it's all yours now.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: If we save 'em up, we can get more than a sticker this time.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Stop telling me how to spend my tickets.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I know, but you wanted the big thing.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wow, can you imagine what people would say if they saw us dancing together?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: They'd be like, 'what's up with those two?'

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: 'Did we miss the wedding?' Um, I got it-I'll do this, and you play the racing game, and then we'll switch.

Quote.Speaker: Isabel
Quote.Text: Oh, air hockey, basketball, we could play that. Oh, whack-a-mole.

Quote.Speaker: Isabel
Quote.Text: Two are in the Marines, one's a cop.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Angela versus Isabel. Height, advantage Isabel. Birthing hips, advantage Isabel. Remaining child-bearing years, advantage Isabel. Legal obligation, advantage Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, guys, guys, guys. [steals a cherry from waitress passing buy] Watch this. Ready?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm tying a knot in the stem with my tongue.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, you don't have to do this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [choking] Wow. Oh, wow, that was close.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I would say I kind of have an unfair advantage because I watch reality dating shows like a hawk, and I learn. I absorb information from the strategies of the winners and the losers. Actually, I probably learn more from the losers.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is exactly what I don't want, the drama. I don't want the drama!

Quote.Speaker: Isabel
Quote.Text: [Isabel and Dwight playing whack-a-mole] You are amazing at this. How did you get so good?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Whacking moles. Hit 'em on the head. Whack. Say it with me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Listen, can I talk to you for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Look, I've been thinking. We had a good run. We really did. But you don't need to worry about this whole contract thing anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's just that we both-we want different things. You know, I want a big family.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. I want a big family. Tall. Thick. A big, physically big family. Listen, you go have fun. You're off the hook.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dissolved. Don't worry, you're free. Okay? Okay. See you later.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Michael playing air guitar on pool table] Wow. Maybe we should tell her that he's not normally like this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe it should come from a man.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Maybe it should come from a note... with flowers...tomorrow.

Quote.Speaker: Bar Manager
Quote.Text: You wanna pay 400 bucks to re-felt this table?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, why don't you send the bill to 23 I Don't Care Lane, Scranton, Pennsylvania?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Michael, why don't you just get down.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, she can tell I'm on a date, right? Right? I'm just having fun.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? You told on me. That's lame.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, all right. Okay, whoa. I'm just kidding around. I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok, um, why don't we just finish the game? Michael, it's your shot.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She can't talk to us that way.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You guys are stripes, I think...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You let somebody talk to you like that, where does it stop?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I am starting it again!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you guys want some food? The wings are really good here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, you embarrassed my friends in front of me and I'm gonna need you to go back over to the table and apologize.

Quote.Speaker: Bar Manager
Quote.Text: Then I am sorry that I didn't kick you out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am here with my employees. I am here on a date. Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Bar Manager
Quote.Text: Well, uh, I'm the manager here, sir.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, it just so happens that I am a manager too. And the way I manage people is that I touch their hearts and souls with humor, with love and maybe a dash of razzle-dazzle. And I don't see that from you.

Quote.Speaker: Bar Manager
Quote.Text: Is that how you do it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes it is. I am writing a book about it.

Quote.Speaker: Bar Manager
Quote.Text: Really? How much have you written?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I've written all of it... in my head.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If you're really interested, it's called 'Somehow I Manage' and there's going to be a picture of me on the cover, shrugging, with my sleeves rolled up.

Quote.Speaker: Bar Manager
Quote.Text: Huh. Have you read Lee Iacocca's? It's a classic.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Read it? I own it. But no, I have not read it.

Quote.Speaker: Bar Manager
Quote.Text: Dude, tonight! You're not going to want to put it down. It's gonna make you want to go out and buy a Chrysler tomorrow.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We just have to throw everyone off the scent a little, so follow my lead.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Andy sits at table with another woman] Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't normally do this, but...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Just sit down next to a beautiful woman and start talking to myself to confuse other people.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [Erin sits with man, rubs her hand on his thigh] Hey, big boy. Do you like it when I do that?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Andy spits out his drink] What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We didn't say we were gonna, like, start groping strangers!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I was flirting with a man.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Get in here. [Andy and Erin go into photo booth] Where did you learn to talk like that?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, what movie? Black Snake Moan?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I manage a paper company-Dunder Mifflin/Sabre.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I did. I actually put it in your bowl.

Quote.Speaker: Bar Manager
Quote.Text: Whoa, a lot of Stanley Hudson's in here.

Quote.Speaker: Bar Manager
Quote.Text: You just won yourself a lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, he's not usually like that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He's more, just... like... you can go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Julie! You having fun? [Julie leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Bar Manager
Quote.Text: So... when are you coming in for that free lunch? You're gonna want to come in on a day that I'm working. Uh, maybe I can hear more about that book, too.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey, man, you put together a pretty fun night for everybody. I saw you talking to Hide. Did you hear that dude's life story? It's amazing, right?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I couldn't understand a word he said.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Let me tell you something, Oscar. All right, Matt's an okay dude, but he's a dummy. You guys got nothing in common.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Maybe you're right. I should count myself lucky.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: There he is! Hey, hey, hey.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is not what I want my relationship to look like. [holding photo strip of he and Erin fighting]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [over PA] Hi, ladies and gentlemen. My name is Andrew Bernard, and I've been on two dates with Erin Hannon and they went well, and there will probably be more. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know, it got to the point where keeping it a secret was just too much drama. And I hate drama, so there you go.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I know, I do, right? I'm a total drama queen.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: With this move, he can't get you.

Quote.Speaker: Isabel
Quote.Text: Well, I think that he could counter that move. The Scranton strangler is a professional strangler.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, please. I wish he'd come after me. I would be like-aaah!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You are hereby served with a summons to appear in Lackawanna county court.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no. [trying to talk over her] Blah blah blah blah!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: For breach of contract with Angela Noelle Martin.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Dwight recently entered into a contract with me, establishing intent to conceive and raise a child with me.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Did he not tell you that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're really putting me in an awkward position here.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Do you plan on raising a child with me? Or do you plan on breaking this contract?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You'll see me in small claims court!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [crying] Then, I spilled my drink, and they wouldn't give me a refill.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, we have to get home.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Halperts, wait up. Oh, what a great night. Got to hang out with my peeps. Sort of did okay with a new young lady.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think I did. But I can't take all of the credit. Some of the credit is due, in fact, to my good friend, Date Mike. Nice to meet me.

Quote.Speaker: Hide
Quote.Text: In Japan, heart surgeon. Number one. Steady hand. One day, yakuza boss need new heart. I do operation. But, mistake! Yakuza boss die. Yakuza very mad. I hide in fishing boat, come to America. No English, no food, no money. Darryl give me job. Now I have house, American car, and new woman. Darryl save life. My big secret: I kill yakuza boss on purpose. I good surgeon. The best!
